Jul 1, 2016

Just in Time or not

Java is known to compile source code to Bytecode, thus enabling portability at the price of having a Java Virtual Machine (JVM) installed on the node that needs to execute your Bytecode. The main drawback of Bytecode is that it needs to be interpreted (i.e. translated to binary code understandable by a CPU), which incurs some performance penalties. Fortunately, like several modern runtime environments (such as the ones used for the .NET or Racket language), Java makes use of dynamic translation to
